Thank you for the fine collection. It looks promising, as I am in the process of downloading it.

I don't see why Calibre's 'Add books - multiple items per directory' option won't work, though...

Just one note to those who are adding this much items to their kindles for the first time:
After you add the books, Kindle will start indexing the content of these books, 2-4 minutes for each. I wouldn't surprise if this particular collection shall need two days to complete the indexations. During this indexing process, the Main Menu may become sluggish. However, you may continue reading with no problems.
If you'll have a computer available, I don't see a point of overloading your Kindle with thousands of books. Keep them on Calibre and sync when needed.
Thanks for the collection once more.

To those who are having problems mass adding these to calibre. In the left hand corner select the option to add books from directories, including sub directories (Multiple books per directory) and open up the MOBI folder, when that folder opens you should be able to see folders titled by the authors names. Make sure NONE of the folders are selected (highlighted) and click open. After that the books should automatically start adding to the calibre library. Hope this helps.

Try mobipocket reader. It is the ebook reader created by Amazon for .prc .mobi files. It converts other file formats into .prc and reads. It is userfriendly even though it loses some of the formating in picture type pdf files.

@KOBKED-

Try mobipocket e book reader. It is by Amazon themselves. It converts numerous formats to .PRC  files and reads in computer. There are many features like font size, color, type; space, columns, etc etc.  It is user-friendly too.

Anyone having trouble with this here is why. 2 Folders in this pack are named Steven D. Levitt & Steven J., the second folders is named Noah J. Goldstein & J. Martin & Robert B. Note that each name ends in a period. This is an illegal file name for Windows. These files were most likely created on a MAC. Once created, you can move them around the drive they were created on but you cannot delete them and will get an error "Cannot delete File: Cannot read from the source file or disc" I found this website helpfull in removeing these 2 folders. I imagine this is going to be a problem as more different phone OS's appear with there own character limitations different form Windows. A note to Mac users, if your going to make a torrent and share files...please remeber that Windows reserves certain charaters for use by the OS and are not allowed in file names
here is the website, sorry forgot to add it to my comment http://blog.dotsmart.net/2008/06/12/solved-cannot-read-from-the-source-file-or-disk/

Lots of comments but no-one commented on the quality. It's barely OK. All books are missing paragraphs. In the middle of a word or a paragraph it just cuts off. You get the gist of the book but it is still very annoying especially if down the line the story refers to something that you didn't read because it was deleted.

I wonder who bothered to edit the books like this and than post them and to what purpose?
@LynnW98 - no, we're not interested in you making money on illegal copies of ebooks. Here at least they're free.

@HighSeedRatio - I've read about 25 books out of this torrent, and while there might be the odd misspelling or random capital letter (very very infrequently, I might add) I have yet to encounter a book missing entire paragraphs or sentences, and none of them are so bad that you only get the "gist" of the book. I may have a lot more to read, but if it were as bad as you're trying to make it sound, then surely I would have run into it by now. So far, I have been incredibly pleased with the quality of this torrent.

Ignore highseedratio  (oh the irony!).

Yet again complete rubbish from him and I note he has never uploaded anything.

Just an industry shit trying to put people of downloading these superb ebooks.

Does anyone know a good forum for discussing torrented ebook quality?  If you go on any ebook forum and even mention torrent they all go high and mighty.  Some torrented books are so good I guess that they are from te original retail, stripped of the DRM, but other were probably scanned, then OCR'd and are absolutely filled with mistakes.  I've done this myself in the past, so I know fof the problems that can arise, but I just want to be able to discuss torrented book quality.  Like for example I have two copies of Angels and Demons mobi, one has the illustrations, the other doesn't.  But if you didn't know there were supposed to be illustrations you'd never know.
Everyone, please quit posting comments where all you say is "thank you!", just hit the + on the Quality, it means the same thing and reduces comment clutter.
Also, for reading on a desktop PC, you can always use the Amazon Kindle for PC application :)
Thank you uploader for this magnificent effort. Kudos :)
